meaning: Esq., way, manner, situation, polite suffix

onyomiExamples.meaning: appearing ..., looking ..., way to ..., method of ...ing, form, style, design, like, similar to, thing (thought or spoken)
uniform, equal, even, the same, identical, common, ordinary, usual

kunyomiExamples.meaning: Mr., Mrs., Miss, Ms., makes a word more polite (usu. in fixed expressions), state, situation, appearance, manner
nobleman, dignitary, lord, feudal lord (of the Edo period), daimyō, man brought up away from the world, arrogant man with little knowledge of the ways of the world
thank you (for the meal), that was a delicious meal, thank you (for displaying lovey-dovey behaviour)
karayuki-san, young Japanese women who were sent to work (mainly as prostitutes) in foreign countries, esp. in Southeast Asia (Meiji to early Showa)
